texts.en:
The Djiguène Bakhna 39 group is composed of five women who live in the same house and who all sell fruits and vegetables.

The group's representative, Mame Kardiata, has over ten years of experience selling fruits and vegetables. She will use the loan to buy fruit. In the future, she hopes to open her own store.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables intended for resale

loans.name: Mumbi

texts.en:
Mumbi is a 57 year old married woman.  She has 6 children ranging in age from 20 years to 39 years.  She describes herself to be social and talkative. 

She operates a retail stall where she sells juice, sodas, bread, wheat flour, salt, maize flour, beans etc.  She has been involved in this business for 10 years.  Her business is located at a comercial area and her primary customers are repeat and new ones.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds.  She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more wheat flour and cooking fat.  Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Souleymane

texts.fr:
Né en Novembre 1964 à Doumanani préfecture de Sikasso, Souleymane est polygame avec 2 femmes et père 11 enfants résidant à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso.
Monsieur  Souleymane après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès,  s’est initié il y a environ deux années au domaine du commerce notamment à la vente du bois de chauffe dans lequel il s'approvisionne à Denderso et environnants. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son deuxième prêt individuel; le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé.
 Avec ce deuxième prêt, il compte acheter 5 chargements de camion “10 tonnes” en bois de chauffe. 
 Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 175 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Souleymane was born in November 1964 in Doumanani, a prefecture of Sikasso. He is a polygamist, and he has two wives and eleven children. His family lives in Hamdallaye, a working-class neighborhood in the city of Sikasso.

About two years ago, after having pursued several business activities unsuccessfully, Souleymane began buying and selling firewood. He buys the firewood in Denderso and its surrounding areas. He is in very high demand thanks to the quality of his product.

To satisfy his ever-growing customer base, he decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is his second individual loan through Soro Yiriwaso. His first loan was repaid properly.

With this second loan, he plans to buy five truckloads (10 tonnes) of firewood.

With this loan, he plans to achieve monthly profits of 175,000 FCFA, which will mainly the used to cover family expenses and pay the interest of his loan. The rest will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy firewood

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline has been in farming for 7 years with her milk and egg products being sold in the local market.  She is 40 years old and married with 3 year old child.

Evaline has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds.  She says the 7 years of experience in farming has helped her acquire good skills and she hopes her business will continue to grow.  She added a dairy cow to provide milk both for family consumption and resale to provide other family basic needs.

She says animal diseases remains a challenge in farming.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Yamoussa

texts.fr:
Né vers 1967 à Ouayere commune de Farakala, Monsieur  Yamoussa  est marié et père de cinq enfants. Il réside avec ses deux femmes et ses enfants  à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrtive de la république du Mali).
 N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école et après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, il s’est vite initié aux activités commerciales notamment aux stockage et commercialisation des céréales, il y a maintenant sept  ans.  Avec une telle expérience dans ce domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation et accueille beaucoup de commandes, mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins fait défaut. 
Ainsi, il décida d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel il sollicite ce premier crédit  qui lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de mieux répondre aux attentes de ses clients. 
Avec ce premier prêt il compte acheter 20 sacs de mil, 30 sacs de maïs et 20 sacs de riz.
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 270 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité principale.
texts.en:
Yamoussa was born around 1967 in Ouayere, a district of Farakala. He is married and has five children. He lives with his two wives and his children in Hamdallaye, a working-class neighborhood in the city of Sikasso (the third-largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali).

Not having had the chance to attend school, and after having pursued several business activities unsuccessfully, he quickly became involved in commercial activities, namely the stocking and marketing of cereals. He began this line of work seven years ago. Thanks to his extensive experience in the field, he has a strong reputation and receives many orders. However, he lacks the necessary resources to meet this demand.

That is the reason why he has decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. It is with Soro Yiriwaso that he is asking for his first loan which will allow him to increase his capital so that he can better meet the needs of his clients.

With this first loan, he plans to buy 20 bags of millet, 30 bags of corn, and 20 bags of rice.

With this loan, he plans to achieve monthly profits of 270,000 FCFA, which will be used to cover most of his business expenses, family expenses, and pay the interest of his loan. The rest will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 38 year old restaurant owner in Mariakani.  She is a married mother of three.  She has been operating the restaurant for the past twelve years with great success. 

This is Esther’s fifth business loan from KADET LTD.  She plans to renovate her restaurant and purchase more chairs and tables. 

She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.  She hopes to excel in the business and have a happy family.

loans.use: To renovate her restaurant and purchase more chairs and tables

loans.name: Zakaria

texts.fr:
Né en Janvier 1970 à Sikasso Monsieur Zakaria est marié et père de 8 enfants résidant dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Mancourani II, le centre ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Zakaria est un dépanneur de radios et télé, qui pour améliorer son entreprise décida d’associer la vente des appareils d’occasion à son activité de dépannage. Il dispose d’un atelier au grand marché de Sikasso, il est beaucoup  sollicité par sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter.
 Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décide de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a quelque mois.  Il est à son premier prêt individuel. 
Monsieur Zakaria vend ses appareils (TV, Radios, Mines Chaînes, DVD, etc) dans son atélier de réparation à ses clients composés généralement de ceux qui sollicitent ses services de réparations
Avec ce premier prêt, il compte acheter 10 DVD, 6 Radios, 5 TV écran 29, 3 Mines Chaînes et des CD. Ses appareils proviennent de la république de Ghana.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour  contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en: Born in January 1970 in Sikasso, Zakaria is married and a father of 8 children living in a large traditional extended family in Mancourani II, the central town of Sikasso (the third largest administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Zakaria is a radio and TV repair man, who decided in order to improve his business, to add the sale of second hand equipment to his repair business. He has a workshop in the 'grand marché' of Sikasso, and is much sought out by his ever growing customer base. With a view to better servicing this growing customer base, he decided several months ago to approach the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is his first individual loan. Zakaria sells his appliances (TV, radio, mini HiFi systems, DVD etc) in his repair workshop to customers - mostly people who have brought in equipment for repair. With this first loan, he intends to purchase 10 DVD players, 5 29 inch TVs, 3 mini HiFi systems, and some CD players. This equipment comes from the Republic of Ghana. With this loan he expects to generate a monthly profit of 200,000 FCFA which will mostly be used to contribute to the family expenses, to pay the loan interest, and the rest will be invested in the business.

loans.use: to purchase electronic equipment

loans.name: Barou

texts.fr:
Né en Juillet 1977 à Sikasso, Monsieur  Barou est marié et père de deux  garçons résidant avec son épouse et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Fama, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso  (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur  Barou après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès,  s’est initié au domaine de l’aviculture depuis l’année 2008. Il dispose d’une  ferme non loin de la ville de Sikasso où il y a des centaines de tête d’oiseaux (poulet, pintade, oie, dindon, pigeon, etc.). Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses volailles qui sont de bonnes qualités et bien suivis par des vétérinaires qualifiés. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décide de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel.
 Avec ce premier prêt, il compte acheter 50 poulets, 5 pintades, 5 paires de dindons, 5 paires de canards, 4 paires d’oie, des médicaments et nourritures de sa base cour  Il s'approvisionne dans les villages environnants de la ville de Sikasso.
Avec ce prêt il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 175 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en: Born in July 1977 in Sikasso, Barou is a married father of two boys. He lives with this wife and their children in a large traditional extended family in Fama, one of the urban regions of the town of Sikasso (the third largest administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having tried his hand at several activities without success, he turned his hand to the rearing of poultry in 2008. He has a farm not far from the town of Sikasso, where there are hundreds of birds (chickens, guinea fowl, geese, turkeys, pigeons etc). He is much sought after by his customers for the quality of his poultry, which are of a high standard and properly overseen by qualified veterinary professionals. In order to satisfy his growing customer base, he decided to approach the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, where this is his first individual loan. With this first loan, he plans to purchase 50 chickens, 5 guinea fowl, 5 brace of turkeys, 5 brace of duck, 4 brace of geese, plus medication and feed for his poultry flock. He does his purchasing in the villages surrounding the town of Sikasso. With this loan he expects to generate a monthly profit of 175,000 FCFA which will principally be used to increase his contribution to the family expenses, to repay the interest on the loan, and the rest will be invested in the business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry, feed and medication

loans.name: Fullah Group

texts.en:
Alimamy is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs.  Alimamy was born in Makeni city about thirty-two years ago.  He is married to a trader and the couple have three children – two in primary school and one in secondary school. 

For nine years now, Alimamy has been a businessman.  He sells market food – onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), etc.  With the help of this loan, Alimamy and members of his group will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Alimamy is going to use his share of the loan to buy onions, margi, palm-oil, etc. in large quantities to add to his business.

loans.use: To buy onions, margi, palm-oil, etc. in large quantities to add to his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stocks of cereal products

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Denis is 30 years old, married with two children ages 3 and 6.  He does plumbing to earn a living,he has been in the business for 3 years and describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business.  He hopes to expand his business and be financially stable in the future.  He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy taps, rubbers and filters.

loans.use: To buy taps, rubbers and filters

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is thirty years old and he is married with two children.  He runs an Agrovet chemical shop in Oloitoktok.  He  has been in the business for one year now and gets a monthly income of sixty eight thousand shillings.

This will be John’s first loan from KADET LTD.  He plans to use the entire loan to purchase more agrovet chemicals.  With the profits that he will get, he will add more stock to his business. 

In the future he wants to be able to expand his shop to be a wholesale agrovet chemicals shop.

loans.use: To buy more Agrovet stock for sale

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 35 years old and married with 5 children who are between the ages of 12 and 1 years old.  She has been actively farming in her home area of Kitale for eight years and sells her farm produce of milk, maize and beans to the local market.  Besides farming she operates a food vending business with her sales made to casual workers in the town, especially in construction sites.

Eunice has requested a loan of  35,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to boost her poultry farming by buying more birds.  She says this will enable her to enjoy the economies of scale and give better returns for her investment.  She aspires to grow her business so that she can sustain high transport costs to supply the goods to the market and to have access to better markets.

Eunice is however worried about the high cost of treating poultry birds for diseases.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr:
Née vers 1977 à Sikasso, Salimata est mariée et mère de cinq enfants, elle réside avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une famille nucléaire à Médine-Sikasso.
Salimata après avoir avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès,  s’est initiée au domaine du commerce avec la vente de légumes. Elle vend au nouveau marché de Médine où elle dispose d’une place et table. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décide de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ cinq mois. Ainsi, elle sollicite son premier crédit qui lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour pouvoir acheter 15 sacs de pomme et de terre et 12 sacs d’oignons de graines différentes.
 Ses marchandises sont achetées dans les localités environnantes de la ville de Sikasso pour être vendues en détail au comptant les jours de foire à une clientèle composée essentiellement de forains.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Born around 1977 in Sikasso, Ms. Salimata is a married mother of five children. She resides with her husband and their children in a nuclear family in Médine-Sikasso. After having run several businesses without success, Salimata became familiar with the domain of commerce by selling vegetables. She makes her sales at the new market of Médine, where she has a spot for her table. She is in high demand by her customers for the quality of her goods. 

To satisfy her burgeoning customer base, Salimata decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso about five months ago. Thus, she is requesting her first loan that will enable her to increase her business capital for buying 15 sacks of potatoes and 12 sacks of onion of various types. Her merchandise is purchased in towns surrounding Sikasso City and then sold retail for cash on market days. Her customers are composed essentially of vendors. 

Salimata envisions using this loan to make a monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to increase her business capital, to help with family expenses, and to cover the loan interest.

loans.use: to buy onions and potatoes

loans.name: Phenny

texts.en:
Phenny is 46 years old and a retail shop proprietor in Voi.  She is a widowed mother of four.  She has been running her shop for the past seven years and the business is doing great. 

This is her fifth business loan from KADET LTD.  She plans to buy more sugar, cooking oil, washing powders and tooth paste to add to her stock. 

She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and buy a piece of land to construct a permanent house.  She hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, cooking oil, washing powders and tooth paste.

loans.name: Zoubairou

texts.fr:
Né en Novembre 1974 à Sikasso, Monsieur  Zoubairou  est marié et père des trois enfants. Il réside avec sa famille dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Wayerma I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso.
Monsieur Zoubairou est dans ce domaine du commerce d’engrais et semences, pesticides et insecticides depuis sa tendre enfance. Cette activité est le seul métier de la famille depuis au temps de son père, donc il connaît le domaine en détail mais les moyens lui font défaut pour pouvoir satisfaire ainsi sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter.
 Il décide alors de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  il est à son premier crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter 3 cartons de semences PV, 5 cartons de semences tropical, 50 sacs d’engrais 13 boîte pesticides et insecticides. Il s’approvisionne au Ghana et en Côte d’Ivoire avant de les revendre en gros et en détail dans sa boutique à une clientèle composée généralement d’agriculteurs, de jardiniers, etc. Certains de ses clients payent au comptant, d’autre à crédit.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour  contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born on November 1974 in Sikasso, Mr. Zoubairou is a married father of three children. He resides with his family in a large traditional extended family in Wayerma I, a working-class district of Sikasso City. Mr. Zoubairou has been in the business of selling fertilizer, seeds, pesticides, and insecticides since he was very young. This business has been the family's only trade since his father's time, so he has a detailed knowledge of the sector. 

But he is short on funds for satisfying his ever-growing customer base. He has therefore decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on his first loan, which will enable him to buy 3 boxes of PV seeds, 5 boxes of tropical seeds, 50 sacks of fertilizer, and 13 containers of pesticides et insecticides. 

He gets his supplies from Ghana and from Cote d'Ivoire and then sells them wholesale and retail in his shop. His customers are composed generally of farmers, gardeners, etc. Some of his customers pay in cash, others on credit. 

With this loan, Mr. Zoubairou envisions making a monthly profit of 200,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to help with family expenses, to pay the loan interest, and to invest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to buy various farming supplies

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena, a mother of one child, is married to Emmanuel who helps her support the family. She has a cyber business which she wants to expand. The business earns her a monthly income of about Kshs 3,000 and she has been in this business for three years.

She has requested a loan of Kshs 5,000 that would help her expand her business. Philomena’s big dream is to open a computer college of her own.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a father of 4 children between the ages of 12 and 5 years, with all schooling. He has been producing maize, vegetables and tomatoes for the local market in his home area of Kitale town for the last 10 years.

Simon has requested a loan of 36,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says he wants to diversify his farming so that he can get milk for family consumption as well as for retail, in order to generate more income to meet other basic needs like the education of the children.

He concurs with other farmers on the poor infrastructure and price fluctuation as the major challenges in the farming business. He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for their loan services.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 31 years old and married with two children, aged 1 and 10. He does quarrying to earn a living and he has been in the business for 11 years. He describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya he has been able to save his income and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to rent a productive quarry.

loans.use: To rent a productive quarry.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a forty-four-year-old woman. She is married and a mother of eight children. Mary runs a green grocery in Oloitoktok. She has been in the business for one year now and gets a monthly income of about eleven thousand five hundred shillings.

This will be Mary’s first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase more foodstuffs for her grocery shop. With the profit that she will get she wants to expand her greengrocer shop. In future she wants to continue to expand her shop and invest in farming practices.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Meliyo

texts.en:
Meliyo is fifty-three years old. He is married and has eight children. Meliyo is a livestock farmer in Loitoktok. He has been in the business for twenty years now and gets a monthly income of about twelve thousand five hundred shillings.

This will be Meliyo’s first loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to purchase more cows and goats for resale. With the profit that he will get he wants to expand his livestock business. In future he wants to be able to do well in the livestock and farming industry.

loans.use: To buy more cows and goats for resale.

loans.name: Ta-Kilie-Su Group

texts.en:
Fatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Makeni city thirty-two years ago. She is married to a trader and the couple has four children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Fatu sells market food: onions, tomatoes, salt, rice, palm oil, etc. She has been a businesswoman for four years now. 

With the help of this loan, she and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Fatu will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy onions, tomatoes, salt, rice, palm oil, etc. in bulk to add to her business.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 50-year-old retail shop proprietor in Bamburi, Mombasa. She also runs a salon to supplement her income. She has been running the retail shop for the last ten years and she is doing great.
 
This is Christine’s second business loan from KADET LTD. She plans to purchase more sugar, cooking oil, maize flour and rice to add to the stock in her shop. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her salon business. She hopes to have many businesses.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, cooking oil, maize flour and rice.

loans.name: Clementina

texts.en:
Clementina is a 36-year-old poultry keeper in Mikindani, Mombasa. She is a married mother of two. She has been successfully selling chickens and eggs to her customers for the past three years.

This is Clementina’s third business loan from KADET LTD. She plans to construct a bigger poultry house and purchase more chicks for raising. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and repay her loan. She hopes to have a well established business.

loans.use: to construct a bigger poultry house and purchase more chicks.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 37-year-old married woman. She has 2 children, ages 9 and 15 years. She describes herself to be honest and God-fearing. She operates a a farm where she sells tree seedlings. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located at a strategic place and her primary sales are to passers-by and repeat customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be irrigation problems when it's dry. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more tree seeds. Elizabeth's business goal is to make the best nursery bed and venture into a retail shop within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more trees seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Damarys

texts.en:
Damarys is a resident and a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya where she has practiced farming for six years, with her farm currently being run with the help of two farmhands and producing milk, maize and beans for the local market. She runs a motorcycle transport business besides farming. She is married with three children all above one year and below 7 years.

Damarys has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her purchase and insure a dairy cow. She wants to boost her dairy farming so as to get adequate milk for family consumption as well as for resale to generate income which she intends to use in paying for the education of her children.

She laments the fluctuation in milk prices as  a major challenge.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a fifty-four-year-old woman. A widow and a mother of four children, she sells clothes in Oloitoktok. Elizabeth has been in the business for five years now and gets a monthly income of seven thousand two hundred and fifty shillings.

This will be Elizabeth’s first loan with KADET LTD, and she plans to use the entire loan to purchase more clothes for sale. With the profit that she will get she wants to expand her clothes business. In future she wants to expand her business into a boutique.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Kamuyu Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Kamuyu” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This is not the first loan this group of entrepreneurs has accessed from Kiva lenders. Previous loans have helped a lot in improving the businesses and lives of these borrowers. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are again seeking a new loan of SLL 5,000,000 in order to further expand their businesses. 

The leader of this group is Memuna. Memuna was born in Makeni city, where she is currently residing, together with her husband and four children. Her husband is a diamond miner and two of her children are attending primary school. Memuna has been a businesswoman for twenty years now. She is currently selling dried/smoked fish. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy baskets full of dried fish for sale.

loans.use: to buy baskets full of dried fish for sale.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is forty-four years old. She is single and a mother of two children, and she sells clothes in Oloitoktok. Nancy has been in the business for eleven years now and gets a monthly income of eight thousand shillings.

This will be Nancy’s first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase more clothes for sale, and with the profit that she will get, she wants to expand her clothes shop. 

In future she wants to expand her business into a boutique.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en:
Ibtisam is 41 years old and a single lady. Her family are known for making rugs from older generations, but they all used to make them by hand and at their houses. 

Ibtisam has always helped her family since she was young, which gives her the experience to start a business out of them and improve the process of making them. so six years ago she bought special machines for making those rugs and sells them in the market. And through these six years, Ibtisam was able to expand the business and make a medium-sized workshop, employing people to support their families.

She also started participating in showrooms and exhibitions to show her products that were not only limited to rugs used on floors, but she also created wall hanging rugs, and also recently started taking special orders to make a specific picture on the rug using wool.

Now Ibtisam has applied for a loan so start working on expanding her business and build a bigger workshop or a factory for making rugs where she will be able to help more families, and she also wants to start conducting training courses to teach  rug-making for youths.

loans.use: to start working on expanding her business and build a bigger workshop.

loans.name: Yvotykuéra Omba'apóva Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
12 mujeres de la ciudad de Villa Elisa vieron una gran forma de superarse por medio del trabajo en equipo y con la ayuda de la fundación paraguaya y por medio de su programa de mujeres emprendedoras. Ellas desean salir adelante ya ayudar a sus familias con el día a día.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Sadi, quien se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de bebidas, como ser cervezas, vinos, gaseosas, whiskys, y demás. Por medio de sus ventas puede ayudar a su familia y también mantener su hogar. Ella es una mujer luchadora, que no se cansa de trabajar, pues de esa forma ayuda a todos los suyos.
Ella solicita la ayuda de kiva y fundación para la compra de las bebidas que vende, de esa forma podrá estar abastecida para los pedidos de sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de estas instituciones.
texts.en:
12 women from the city of Villa Elisa saw a great way of excelling by means of teamwork and the help of the Paraguayan Foundation and through their program for women entrepreneurs. They want to succeed in helping their families with the day to day.
On of the members is Sadi, who sells all types of beverages for a living, like beer, wine, soda, whiskeys and more. By means of her sales, she can help her family and also maintain her home. She is a fighter, she never tires of working, since in that way she helps her own.
She is requesting the assistance of kiva and the foundation in order to purchase the drinks that she sells. That way, she will be able to be stocked for her client orders. She is thankful for the opportunity that she is receiving from these institutions.

loans.use: to purchase beer, wine, soda, whiskey and more.

loans.name: Yervand

texts.ru:
Ерванд родился в 1948 году в деревне Ахвани (Aghvani), Сьюникского региона. После окончания сельской средней школы он поступил в Ереванский Зооветеринарный институт. 
Ерванд женат и у него двое сыновей. Оба сына живут в Ереване и работают спасателями в МЧС (Министерство Чрезвычайных Ситуаций). Жена Ерванда работает учительницей армянского языка в средней  школе, а сам Ерванд работает секретарем в сельской администрации. 
Начиная с 1998 года Ерванд занимается сельским хозяйством в деревне Ахвани. На своем участке он выращивает картофель и фасоль на продажу. Также Ерванд разводит пчел и продает мед в городе Капане. Ерванд говорит, что пчеловодство достаточно трудное занятие, но оно приносит неплохой доход и поэтому он хочет увеличить количество ульев. 
Благодаря своей сельскохозяйственной деятельности Ерванд содержит свою семью, так как зарплаты бывает недостаточно для обеспечения семьи всем необходимым.   
Ерванду необходим кредит на сумму 300.000 драм для покупки 6 новых ульев, а также для покупки рамок для меда, воска и новой спецодежды для занятия пчеловодством.
texts.en: Yervand was born in 1948 in the Aghvani village of the Syunik region.  He was accepted to the Yerevan Zoo Veterinary Institute after finishing a village secondary school.  Yervand is married and has two sons.  Both of his sons live in Yerevan and work as rescuers for the MES (Ministry of Emergency Situations).  Yervand's wife works as an Armenian language teacher at a secondary school, and Yervand works as a secretary at the village administration office.  Yervand has been involved in agriculture in the Aghvani village since 1998.  He grows potatoes and beans for sale on his plot of land.  He also keeps bees and sells honey in the city of Kapan.  Yervand says that beekeeping is a fairly difficult business, but it brings in a good income, and this is why he wants to increase the quantity of beehives.  Thanks to his agricultural business, Yervand supports his family because salaries are often not large enough to provide the family with all of the necessities.  Yervand needs a loan in the sum of 300,000 dram to purchase 6 new beehives and also to purchase frames for honey, wax and new speciality clothing for the beekeeping business.

loans.use: to purchase 6 new beehives and also to purchase frames for honey, wax and new speciality clothing

loans.name: Eileen

texts.en:
Eileen is aged 44 and married with  six children with two still attending school. She has been in farming for 20 years and currently runs her farm with the help of one farmhand. Her produce of milk, maize and beans is all sold within the local market.

Eileen has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow to boost her milk production and enable her to provide her family with basic needs.She aspires to have a farm of more and better breeds of cows in the future. She says she will use the income mainly to ensure her children get good education by paying school fees.

She reckons the fluctuation in market prices in a great challenge to farmers.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 30-year-old married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be determined. He is a mason and provides construction services. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in a busy and viable place and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to improve the business. 

In addition to this work, David increases his income by operating a charcoal retail store. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more charcoal for his charcoal retail store. His business goals and dream are to be a supplier of charcoal and best mason within his area within the next five years.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for his retail charcoal business.

loans.name: Djiguéne Bakhna 40 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Djiguène Bakhna 40 composé de 5 femmes  habitent dans un village situé à environ 16 km de la ville principale. Elles font du commerce de fruits  et légumes.
Leur présidente madame Astou  possède une expérience de plus de dix ans. Mariée, madame  Astou participe à la dépense quotidienne de la famille. Elle aimerait ouvrir un magasin pour diminuer ses déplacements.
texts.en:
The "Djiguène Bakhna 40" group comprises five women who live in the same town, located about 16 km from the main city. They sell fruits and vegetables.
The group president, Ms. Astou, has more than ten years' experience in this field. A married woman, Ms. Astou participates in providing for the family. She would like to open a store to reduce her need to travel.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for resale at the local market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase better manure to apply in his farms.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a resident and a farmer in her home area of Kitale in Western Kenya, where she lives with her family of three children, all doing their post-primary education. She is age 44 and has been farming for 20 years.

Susan has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to buy more poultry birds at 20,000 KES and build a bigger poultry housing unit for her growing number of birds (including the ones she has yet to acquire.) She adds that she wants to expand her poultry farming operation since she has enough knowledge to counter the inherent challenges, like bird diseases. She says her main aim is to grow the business well enough to ensure that her children are all schooled.

She says her challenge is seasonal fluctuations in market price.

loans.use: to build a poultry housing unit and buy more birds

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a married woman. She has a son who is 5 years old. She describes herself to be determined and ambitious. She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of clothes. She will use the 10,000-Kenyan-shilling loan to buy more clothes. Her business goal is to be a clothes supplier to retailers within five years.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for selling

loans.name: Mujeres Al Poder Group

texts.es:
El Comité “Mujeres al Poder” cuenta con 16 integrantes todas de un asentamiento de la ciudad de Villa Elisa. Este comité es antiguo y a pesar de tener algunas dificultades siempre supieron salir adelante y hoy en día son mujeres muy trabajadora , activas y responsables.
Una de estas mujeres es la señora Gloria, quien nos cuenta que tiene una pequeña despensa bien surtida. Gracias a su negocio ella puede ayudar a su familia y mantener la casa. Día a día ella empieza a trabajar desde muy temprano y termina ya muy noche. Cuenta que le gusta mucho su negocio y le gustaría, algún día, poder ampliarlo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra bebidas, comestibles, enlatados, azúcar, fideos y demás artículos de primera necesidad. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que le dan a ella y a su grupo.
texts.en:
The committee “Mujeres al Poder” consists of 16 members, all from a settlement of the city of Villa Elisa. This committee is long-standing and in spite of having some difficulties were always able to overcome, and today are very hardworking, active and responsible women.
One of these women is Gloria, who tell us that she has a small, well stocked pantry. Thanks to her business she is able to help her family and maintain the house. Day to day she begins work very early and finishes very late. She says that she likes her business very much, and she would like to some day expand it.
She is requesting a loan in order to buy drinks, groceries, canned goods, sugar, noodles and other basic necessities. She is thankful to the foundation and to kiva for the opportunity they are giving her and her group.

loans.use: to buy drinks, groceries, canned goods, sugar, noodles and other items.

loans.name: Scott

texts.en:
Scott is 22 years old now, and his business is doing well, and his monthly income has gone up to 6,500 Kenyan shillings.

He has applied for a second loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to purchase more stock for sale. With the profit that he will get he wants to expand his curio shop. 

In the future he wants to be able to expand his curio shop into a bigger one.

loans.use: to buy handcrafts for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goats to resell

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew has been in mixed farming in his hometown of Kitale for four years with his farm produce of milk, maize and beans all being sold to the local market. His farm is run with the help of one farmhand and he also operates a clothes-selling business besides farming. He is married and has five children between 12 and one year old.

Andrew has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him make a venture into poultry farming as well. He is optimistic that he will generate enough income to repay the loan owing to the good market for poultry products.

He hopes also to expand his farming acreage by buying more land. He says his farming will enable him to improve the living standards of his children.

Andrew's challenge is poultry diseases, which he says need great management to surmount.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman. She has five children ranging from 27 to 38 years old. She describes herself as honest and innovative. 

She operates a retail store where she sells airtime vouchers and cards. She is an agent of Safaricom company. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located at a viable area. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as sometimes getting insufficient float for customers from Safaricom company. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more airtime vouchers and cards. Lucy's business goal is to venture into and run a tailoring shop within five years.

loans.use: To buy more airtime and safaricom cards.

loans.name: Djiguène B Akhna 41 Group

texts.fr:
Djiguène Bakhna 41 est le nom d’un groupe de crédit qui rassemble cinq femmes habitant dans un petit village situé à environ 17 km de la ville principale. Ces femmes ont pour activité la vente de fruits et légumes .Elles s’approvisionnent  dans le village même et écoule sa marchandise vers la capitale.
Leur présidente, la dame Racky  est mariée et responsable puisse qu’elle participe à  la dépense quotidienne de son foyer. Elle achète et revend des fruits et légumes .Dans l’avenir elle aimerait avoir sa propre autonomie financière. 
.
texts.en: "Djiguène Bakhna 41" is the name of a loan group comprising five women who live in a small town located about 17 km from the main city. These women run businesses selling fruits and vegetables. They get their supplies in the town itself and sell their merchandise towards the capital. The group president, Ms. Racky, is married and responsible, since she participates in providing for her household's daily expenses. She buys and re-sells fruits and vegetables. In the future, she would like to be financially independent.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is now 26 years old. He used his previous loan well and the business has grown with a good income of about 15,000 KES in a month.

This will be Edwin’s second loan with KADET Ltd. He plans to use the entire loan to purchase more stock for sale. With the profit that he will get he wants to expand his curio shop. 

In the future, he wants to be able to invest more in other business ventures.

loans.use: To buy handicrafts for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase lingerie for sale.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena is a widowed woman. She has two children, age 24 and 28 years. She describes herself as focused and quiet. 

She operates a retail business where she sells cows for slaughtering. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located at a viable and busy area and her primary customers are butchers. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a cow to sell for slaughter. 

Within the next five years, Philomena hopes to own a slaughterhouse.

loans.use: To buy a cow to sell for slaughter.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 46 years old, married, and has four children. He has been a mixed farmer for the last 15 years.

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a registered client in his abode. 

This is his third loan, with which he has planned to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers, seeds and chemicals and also animals for fattening. 

He intends to use part of the return from the loan to plow back into farming and part to repay the loan.

His dreams are to become a famous farmer in the area and to educate his children to higher levels of education. He an industrious man who struggles to achieve if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers, seeds and chemicals.

loans.name: Nohemy

texts.es: Nohemy ha sido reconocida en su sector por ser una persona que siempre ha querido brindarles bienestar a las otras personas con quien convive. Es por esto que Nohemy ha creado un taller de confección a terceros y logró que este creciera hasta el punto en el que tuviese que contratar a una gran cantidad de madres solteras cabezas de familia. A Nohemy siempre le ha interesado impactar en la vida de las demás personas, y gracias a su taller ha logrado mejorarle la calidad de vida a un muy buen grupo de ellas. Los habitantes de su sector la tienen como una persona que siempre ha buscado ayudar a los demás, y gracias a ella manifiestan que hoy pueden gozar de un trabajo que les permita acceder a un salario que sostenga los gastos del hogar. Nohemy, con 56 años de edad, y un esposo que siempre la ha apoyado, quiere que su taller de confección siempre siga creciendo para poder contratar a más personas que requieran con gran necesidad de un salario, por lo que cada vez le llegan más contratos por parte de sus clientes. En la actualidad, el taller de Nohemy requiere de unos espacios más grandes, pues las personas trabajan a menudo incómodas por la falta de espacios. Es por esto que Nohemy requiere de realizar mejoras locativas a su local, sin embargo, en la actualidad no cuenta con el capital suficiente para hacerlo, pues en la temporada de fin de año hizo grandes donaciones. Nohemy aspira a que un préstamo le permita acceder a realizar dichas mejoras locativas, y sus empleados tengan un sitio de trabajo mas confortable que el actual.
texts.en:
Nohemy has been recognized in her area as being a person who has always wished to bring wellbeing to the other people with whom she associates. For that reason Nohemy has created a dressmaking workshop for others, and managed to make it grow to the point at which she had to hire a great number of single mothers who are heads of families. Nohemy has always been interested in impacting the lives of other people and thanks to her workshop she has successfully improved the quality of life for a good number of them. The residents in her area consider her to be a person who has always looked for a way to help others, and thanks to her, they say that today they may enjoy work that allows them to receive a salary which covers household expenses. 

Nohemy, with her 56 years of age and a husband who has always supported her, wants her dressmaking workshop to grow continually in order to hire more persons who are very much in need of a salary, and so more and more contracts keep arriving from her customers. Currently Nohemy's workshop requires larger areas since the people who work there are often uncomfortable because of the lack of space. Therefore Nohemy must make structural improvements to her location but currently does not have sufficient capital to do it since she made large donations during the end-of-the-year season. 

Nohemy aspires to receive a loan that will allow her to carry out said structural improvements, in order that her employees will have a workplace which is more comfortable than the current one.

loans.use: to make structural improvements to her dressmaking workshop, since there are many people working in a very small space.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es: Marleny es socia del Banco Comunal Rubi, tiene 33 años, se dedica a la venta de carne en el Mercado, es madre de 4 hijos, es casada y socia de Finca Perú desde hace 1 año, le encanta las capacitaciones, y todo lo que aprende lo pone en práctica en su negocio y en su familia, los préstamos que saco le ayudaron a poder terminar de hacer su casa y le ayudaron en los estudios de sus hijos. Ahora el préstamo que esta solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de reces.
texts.en:
Marleny is a member of a the Rubi communal bank. She is 33 years old and devotes herself to selling meat at the market. She is the mother of four children, married, and has been a member of Finca Perú for one year. She is delighted with the trainings and puts everything she learns to practice in her business and in her family. The loans she took out helped her complete the construction of her house and with her children's education. 

Now the loan she is seeking will be invested in the purchase of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for slaughter and sale.

loans.name: Nixon

texts.en:
Nixon is age 35 and has been in active farming in his hometown of Kitale for five years. He is married with four children aged between 12 and 6 years. He says his family livelihood relies fully on farming.

Nixon has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow to help him boost his dairy income. He adds that dairy farming has been of great help to his family by providing milk for their daily consumption as well as income to meet other basic requirements.

Nixon says the major challenge of poor feed remains, especially during droughts.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Qais

texts.en:
Qais is 25 years old and single. He has two sisters and a younger brother. 

He is a business administration student at one the Jordanian universities and he wants to graduate as soon as possible so he can start working, help his family and save for his future.

He has applied for this loan to pay for his upcoming semester’s fees.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester’s fees

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 27-year-old single woman. She has no children yet. She describes herself to be honest and faithful. She operates a retail business where she sells items such as Cutex, earrings, braids, etc. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a viable and busy area and her primary customers are residents. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more braids, Cutex, earrings, etc. 

Hellen's business goal is to run at least five more such retail stores within five years.

loans.use: To buy more braids, Cutex, earrings, etc.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es: Viviana es socia del Banco Comunal La Paz, tiene 42 años, tiene una tienda de abarrotes en Yanama, es madre de 4 hijos, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 5 años, recuerda que siempre trabajó, pero los préstamos que ha recibido en estos últimos años le ayudó mucho a poder cumplir sus metas y sus sueños, uno de ellos era poder ampliar su casa, las capacitaciones que le brindan le ayudan a poder tener una base para tener un buen negocio y tener una buena familia, con el préstamo comprará azúcar, arroz, fideos.
texts.en:
Viviana is a member of the La Paz communal bank. She is 42 years old and has a general store in Yanama. She is the mother of four children and has been a member of Finca Perú for five years. She recalls that she has always worked, but the loans she has received in recent years have helped her a lot in being able to meet her goals and realize her dreams, one of which was to expand her home. The trainings that they offer her allow her to have a good foundation on which to have a good business and a good family. 

With the loan she will purchase sugar, rice and beans.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice and beans wholesale.

loans.name: El Comité Inmaculada Concepción De María Group

texts.es:
El comité Inmaculada Concepción de María se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes,  pero también realizan conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.  Ellas están muy contentas por formar parte del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya y desean llegar al máximo nivel del programa.
La Señora María es una de las integrantes del comité, ella es Docente y también se dedica  confeccionar sabanas , almohadas , y fundas, los cuales vende mucho, pues siempre tiene muy buena calidad los productos que ella hace. Cuenta que está casada y que su marido es guardia de seguridad, y de esa forma ambos se ayudan con los gastos de la casa, juntos tienen  2 hijas quienes son el motivo de lucha de María y de su marido, ya que quieren darles una vida cómoda y sin privaciones.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas de diversos tipos, hilos, agujas, y demás insumos necesarios para elaborar sus sabanas, fundas y demás. Ella al igual que sus amigas agradece a Kiva por la oportunidad que les dan.
texts.en:
The Inmaculada Concepción de María committee was formed by the union of a number of neighbors from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. All the members of the committee have their own independent businesses, but they also carry out activities jointly, which strengthens group bonding. They are very happy to make up part of the program for enterprising women of the Fundación Paraguaya and would like to reach the program's maximum level. 

Ms. María is one of the committee's members. She is a teacher and also devotes herself to making sheets, pillows and pillowcases of which she sells a lot, since the products she makes have always been of very high quality. She says she is married and that her husband is a security guard, and thus they both help with household expenses. Together they have two children who are the motive for María and her husband's struggles, since they wish to give them a comfortable life without deprivations. 

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of various kinds of cloth, thread, needs and other supplies needed to make her sheets, pillowcases and other items. She along with her friends gives thanks to Kiva for the opportunity they are being given.

loans.use: to purchase various types of cloth, thread, needs and other supplies.

loans.name: Clotilde Isabel

texts.es:
Clotilde es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella vive en ica, una ciudad caracterizada por su clima cálido en cualquier época del año y conocida también por la laguna de Huacachina, considerada el Oasis de América; Clotilde aprendió lo que es ganarse el pan con le sudor de la frente desde muy joven ya que tuvo que trabajar desde niña para ayudar a sus padres porque tenían pocos recursos económicos.

Clotilde se dedica actualmente a la venta de gaseosas, golosinas, abarrotes, ella trabaja muy duro  le dedica a su labor alrededor de 8 horas diarias, ella considera que le va bien en su negocio debido a que atiende a sus clientes con mucho respeto y amabilidad, por ello siempre regresan a su negocio.

Clotilde está muy feliz con la ayuda brindada  por los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio (abarrotes, golosinas y con ello mejorara mucho ya que tendrá mas ingresos, mejorando su calidad de vida y permitiéndole seguir ahorrando para poder cumplir su sueño más grande: “Terminar de construir su vivienda”
texts.en:
Clotilde is a very hardworking woman. She lives in Ica, a city characterized by its year-round warm climate and which is also known for Huacachina Lake, considered to be America's Oasis. Clotilde learned from a very early age what it is to earn one's daily bread by the sweat of one's brow, since she had to work as a child helping her parents as they had very few economic resources. 

Clotilde currently devotes herself to selling soft drinks, sweets and groceries. She works very hard and devotes herself to her labors around eight hours a day. She believes things are going well for her in her business because she serves her customers with a great deal of respect and kindness, and so they always return to her business. 

Clotilde is very happy with the help provided by the Kiva lenders since, thanks to their support, she will be able to purchase more merchandise for her business (groceries and sweets). Thus she will much improve her income, improving her quality of life and allowing her to continue saving in order to achieve her greatest dream: To finish building her home.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise (groceries, sweets, and soft drinks among other items)

loans.name: Johnny Alfredo

texts.es:
Jonny Alfredo tiene 25 años de edad de estado civil actual casado no tiene hijos, vive con la esposa en el cantón Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías, Perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol.

Jonny se dedica a la Agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, además tiene animales como las vacas, pollos. Las compras y las ventas de los productos agrícolas lo hace en ventanas.

 Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, líquido para plagas.Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar terreno y los abonos para la siembra, Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima.

 El sueño es comprarse un carro.En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar pelota.
texts.en:
Jonny Alfredo, 25, is currently married and has no children; he lives with his wife in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The “La Unión” communal bank is located in Recinto Aguas Frías which belongs to Ventanas Canton.  It’s dedicated to short cycle corn, rice and bean farming.

Jonny is a corn and bean farmer and also has animals like cows and chickens.  His purchases and sales of farming products take place in Ventanas.

He’s asking for the loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer and liquids for infestations.  With support from the loan he’ll be able to buy land and manure for the plants.  The challenges he faces are infestations, illnesses and weather variations.

His dream is to buy a car and in his free time he enjoys playing ball.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.name: Lucila Giralda

texts.es:
Lucila Geralda tiene 53 años de edad es soltera, tiene 3 hijos vive con los hijos de 36, 26 y 18 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías, Perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol.

Lucila se dedica a la Agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol. Las compras y las ventas de los productos agrícolas lo hace en ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, líquidos, fertilizantes. Con la ayuda del crédito podra arrendar más terrenos para poder sembrar y no tener inconvenientes. El sueño es poder comprar una casa.

En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear por el campo.
texts.en:
Lucila Giralda, 53, is single and has three children; she lives with her children who are 36, 26 and 18 years old in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

She is a member of the “La Unión” communal bank is located in Recinto Aguas Frías which belongs to Ventanas Canton.  It’s dedicated to short cycle corn, rice and bean farming.

Lucila is a corn and bean farmer.  Her purchases and sales of farming products take place in Ventanas.

She’s asking for the loan to buy seeds, urea, fertilizer and liquids.  With support from the loan he’ll be able to lease more land to farm problem-free.  Her dream is to be able to buy a house.  In her free time she enjoys going out into the countryside.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, liquids and fertilizer.

loans.name: Endrina Solanye

texts.es:
Solanye es una joven de 20 años muy carismática y sobre todo trabajadora, es madre de un hermoso pequeño de 1 añito al cual cría y saca adelante sola por circunstancias ajenas , ella trabaja muy duro día a día para poder solventa a su pequeño y darle lo que el necesita, en el poco tiempo libre que ella dispone trata de darle mucho cariño a su bebe y se relaja junto a el escuchando música, en especial la relajante para que su bebe también se relaje junto a ella, Solanye solo estudio hasta quinto grado de secundaria, debido a que sus padres no tenían los medios económicos necesarios, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar contabilidad.

Solanye trabaja en la venta de ropa, trabaja 8 horas diarias y atiende a muchos clientes, en ocasiones cuando no tiene quien pueda cuidar de su pequeño mientras trabaja ella, lo lleva junto a ella a donde valla, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene la mejor motivación que cualquier persona pueda tener, su Hijo ya que por el daría la vida y por el es que se sacrifica tanto por salir adelante para que nada le falte.

Solanye está muy feliz y agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo ella podrá comprar mucha más mercadería (ropa)de temporada de verano, con ello mejorara sus ingresos y así podrá seguir ahorrando para poder realizar su gran sueño: “Darle una profesión a su pequeño”
texts.en:
Solanye, 20, is a very charismatic and above all hardworking young woman.  She’s the mother of a beautiful little one-year-old who she raises and cares for alone because of circumstances beyond her control.  She works very hard day by day to support her little one and to give him what he needs.  In the little free time she has she tries to give her baby much love and she relaxes with him listening to music especially relaxing music so that her baby can relax alongside her.  Solanye only finished fifth year of secondary school because her parents lacked the necessary economic means but she would have liked to study Accounting.

Solanye works selling clothes.  She works 8 hours daily and tends to many customers.  On those occasions when no one is available to care for her baby while she works, she takes him with her wherever she goes.  She believes that she does well in her business because she has more motivation than anyone else: her son for whom she’d give her life.  This is why she sacrifices so much to get ahead so that he will lack nothing.

Solanye is very happy and grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their support she will be able to buy much merchandise (clothes) for the summer season with which she’ll improve her income to continue saving toward her great dream: “To give her little one a profession.”

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothes.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
María tiene 44 años de edad pero ella tiene el espíritu de una joven de 20 años, ella vive en la ciudad de mala, ubicado al sur de nuestra capital, ella como buena peruana le gusta mucho su comida y por ello uno de los platos que mas le agrada es el Arroz con pollo, María solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria porque sus padre no tenían los suficientes medios económicos y es por ello que ella aprendió desde muy joven lo que es ganarse el pan con el sudor de su frente. Tiene 3 hijos de los cuales el menor aun estudia y cursa el tercer grado de secundaria.

María tiene su negocio de venta de abarrotes y a su vez a la venta de bebidas gaseosas, cerveza y salchipollo, trabaja alrededor de 14 horas diarias ya que la venta de abarrotes y bebidas lo realiza durante el día y la tarde y en la noche elabora los platillos de salchipollo, puede atender hasta 20 clientes diarios, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio debido a que es muy amable en la atención.

María está muy feliz y agradecida con el apoyo de los prestatarios Kiva porque gracias a su ayuda ella podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio ( abarrotes, bebidas y insumos para la elaboracion de sus platillos) ya que aumentara la variedad de los productos para ofrecer y con ello aumentaran sus ingresos y podrá seguir ahorrando para poder cumplir su gran sueño:” Tener una bodega más amplia”
texts.en:
María, 44, has the spirit of a twenty-year-old.  She lives in the city of Mala located south of the capital.  Like all good Peruvians, she enjoys our cuisine very much and one of her favorite dishes is “Arroz con Pollo” [chicken with rice].  María only finished fifth year of secondary school because her parents did not have sufficient economic resources and this is why she learned how to earn her daily bread with the sweat of her brow since she was very young.  She has three children; the youngest still attends school and is in third grade of secondary school.

María has a business selling groceries but at the same time she also sells soft-drinks, beer and “salchipollo” [fast food consisting of fried potatoes with fried chicken].  She works around 14 hours per day since she does the grocery and beverage sales during the day and then in the evening and night she makes the salchipollo.  She can tend to up to 20 customers daily and she believes that she does well in business because she provides very pleasant service.

María is very happy and grateful for the support from Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business (groceries, beverages and ingredients to make her dishes) thus increasing the variety of her products on offer leading to higher income to continue saving to reach her great dream: “To have a much bigger store.”

loans.use: to buy clothes, groceries, beer and others.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
María Auxiliadora tiene 34 años de edad de estado civil actual casada tiene 4 hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 14, 12, 7 y 4 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías, Perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol.

María se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, fertilizantes, abonos.  Con la ayuda del crédito podrá arrendar terrenos.
El sueño es comprarse una casa grande. No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema en la producción.
En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear con la familia.
texts.en:
María Auxiliadora, 34, is married and has four children; she lives with her husband and children who are 14, 12, 7 and 4 years old in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

She is a member of the “La Unión” communal bank is located in Recinto Aguas Frías which belongs to Ventanas Canton.  It’s dedicated to short cycle corn, rice and bean farming.

María is a corn and rice farmer.  Her purchases and sales of farming products take place in Ventanas.

She’s asking for the loan to buy seeds, urea, fertilizer and manure.  With support from the loan he’ll be able to lease land.  Her dream is to be able to buy a big house.  She’s faced no problems with production and in her free time she likes to go out on family outings.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Virginia Griselda

texts.es:
Virginia Griselda tiene 53 años de edad es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos, vive con los hijos de 29, 13 y 12 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías, Perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol.

Virginia se dedica a la Agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjolde ciclo corto. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en ventanas.
Solicita el crédito para comprar los insumos, fertilizantes, urea, líquidos. Con el apoyo del crédito podrá arrendar más terreno y sembrar un poco más.

El sueño es poder comprarse una casa que tenga jardín. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear.
texts.en:
Virginia Griselda, 53, is a single mother of three children; she lives with her children who are 29, 13 and 12 years old in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

She is a member of the “La Unión” communal bank is located in Recinto Aguas Frías which belongs to Ventanas Canton.  It’s dedicated to short cycle corn, rice and bean farming.

Virginia is a short cycle corn and bean farmer.  Her purchases and sales of farming products take place in Ventanas.

She’s asking for the loan to buy supplies, urea, fertilizer and liquids.  With support from the loan he’ll be able to lease more land and plant a bit more.  Her dream is to be able to buy a house with a garden.  In her free time she likes to go out on outings.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fertilizer, urea and liquids.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, 22 years old, is single and the youngest child among his five brothers and sisters.

Ahmad is a student at the University, majoring in English. He still has two semesters left until graduation. After that, he is planning on working in the field and registering to get a masters degree at the same time.

Today he has applied for a loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Edisson Rolando

texts.es:
Edison Rolando tiene 29 años de edad vive en unión libre, tiene 3 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 9, 6 y 5 años de edad en el cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías, Perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol.

Edison se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de ciclo corto a la siembra de maíz. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Solicita el crédito para la siembra de maíz comprar semillas, fertilizantes, urea, líquidos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá arrendar más terreno para poder sembrar más maíz.

Los desafíos que se le han presentado son la falta de agua a los cultivos.

El sueño es poder arreglar la casa para que la familia viva bien. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Edisson Rolando, 29, lives in a common law relationship and has three children; he lives with his wife and children who are 9, 6 and 5 years old in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

He is a member of the “La Unión” communal bank  located in Recinto Aguas Frías which belongs to Ventanas Canton.  It’s dedicated to short cycle corn, rice and bean farming.

Edisson is a short cycle corn farmer.  His purchases and sales of farming products take place in Ventanas.

He’s asking for the loan to buy seeds, urea, fertilizer and liquids.  With support from the loan he’ll be able to lease more land and plant more corn.  The challenge he faces is the lack of water for his crops.  His dream is to be able to fix the house so that his family can live well.  In his free time he enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, urea and liquids for his corn crops.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo,  las integrantes del comité fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ella, por medio del trabajo en conjunto. Todas ellas son conocidas en el barrio por su unión y por su trabajo en equipo.
La Sra. Nelia, presidenta del grupo, está casada, tiene 3 hijos, es una mujer muy emprendedora e innovadora. Comenta que se dedica a la venta de ropas, con lo cual puede mantener a su familia y cubrir los gastos que diariamente surgen en el hogar. Su sueño es poder tener un local bien surtido donde ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas variadas, con lo cual podrá surtirse y cumplir con unos pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
This committee is from the city of San Lorenzo.  The group members set each of their growth through group work as their main goal.  They are all well known in their neighborhood for their unity and teamwork.

Nelia is group President.  She’s married and has three children.  She’s a very enterprising, innovative woman.  She comments that she sells clothes that she can support her children with and cover daily household expenses that arise.  Her dream is to have a well-stocked store where she can offer more comfort to her customers.

She asks for the loan to by assorted clothes to stock up and fill pending orders she has.

loans.use: to buy clothes for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Bashar

texts.en:
Bashar is a 26-year-old single man, the oldest among his two brothers and sister. 

Bashar is a student at Middle East University majoring in engineering. After graduation he wants to find a job in the field so he can start building for his future. 

He has applied for a loan today to pay for this semester's fees.

loans.use: to pay for this semester’s fees

loans.name: Aydee Filonila

texts.es:
Aydee es social del Banco Comunal Rikchari, tiene 57 años, es dueña de un hostal en la provincia de Sucre, tiene 4 hectáreas de tierra donde siembra quinua y papa, es madre de 4 hijos y socia de Finca Perú desde hace 14 años, una amiga ahora su comadre, la invitó y desde la fecha nunca se retiró de Finca, ha hecho muy buenas amigas en su Banco Comunal. 
Aydee se dedico a muchas cosas, entre ellas confeccionaba ropas para niños y polleras, y así llegó a su tierra natal Sucre y con los préstamos que ha ido recibiendo empezó a construir su hotel.
El préstamo que solicita ahora le ayudará a comprar un terrero al lado para poder ampliar su hotel. Ella esta muy agradecida por todo lo que le han enseñado, Aydee lo valora mucho.
texts.en:
Aydee is a member of the Rikchari communal bank. She is 57 years old and a hotel owner in the province of Sucre. She has four hectares of land where she plants quinoa and potatoes. She is the mother of four children and has been a member of Finca Perú for 14 years. A friend of hers who is also now co-mother-in-law with her invited her to join and since that time she has never left Finca. She has made very good friends in her communal bank. 

Aydee devotes herself to many things, among them making children's clothing and skirts. Thus she arrived at her native land of Sucre and with the loans she has been receiving began to build her hotel. 

The loan she is seeking now will help her buy a neighboring plot of land in order to expand her hotel. She is very appreciative of everything she has been taught; Aydee values it highly.

loans.use: to purchase land for expanding her hotel.

loans.name: Dalberto Bayron

texts.es:
Dalberto Bayron tiene 22 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con la mamá y hermano en el cantón ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías, Perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol.

Dalberto se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, urea, abonos, líquidos, Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los abonos agrícolas.

El sueño es comprarse una casa. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar pelota en el barrio. Los desafíos que se le han presentado son la falta de agua a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Dalberto Bayron is 22 years old, single and has no children. He lives with his mom and brother in the Ventanas Cnton of the Los Ríos province. He is a member of the La Unión [Union] communal bank, located in the Aguas Frías region belonging to the Ventanas canton. This bank is dedicated to short cycle agricultural labors, planting corn, rice and beans. 

Dalberto is dedicated to farming corn and rice. He makes his purchases and sales in Ventanas. He is seeking the loan in order to purchase chemical and natural fertilizers, urea and liquids. With the loan's help he will be able to purchase fertilizers for farming. 

His dream is to purchase a house. In his free time he likes to play ball in the neighborhood. The challenges he has faced include the lack of water for the crops.

loans.use: to purchase chemical and natural fertilizers, urea and liquids.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more dairy cows

loans.name: Ola

texts.en:
Ola is an 18-year-old single girl. She has five brothers and sisters. 

After successfully passing her high school exams, Ola registered herself in a college to get a diploma in the English language. After that she is planning on continuing to get a bachelor's degree too. 

Now Ola has applied for a loan so she can pay for her school fees.

loans.use: to pay her school fees

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 2 to 15 years. She describes herself to be honest and innovative. She operates a grocery stall where she sells vegetables, such as kale, tomatoes, etc., and fruits, like mangoes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located near a busy road and her primary customers are passengers and residents of the home area. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be that sometimes the prices of vegetables and fruits increase. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more vegetables and fruits. Her business goal is to run a well-stocked greengrocer with all kind of fruits and vegetables within five years.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Meliza

texts.es: Meliza es socia del Banco Comunal Rikchari, tiene 20 años, tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, ella estudia Enfermería en un Instituto, a raíz de que sus padres se fueron a vivir a Vilcas ella se tuvo que hacer cargo sus 2 hermanos menores y de la tienda, a su corta edad, aprendió como llevar un negocio, ella educa a sus hermanos y sus padres solo vienen a verlos de vez en cuando para verificar si todo marcha bien, ella se siente muy feliz en Finca Perú por todo lo que aprendió, de esa manera también la relación con sus hermanos es muy buena, aprendió a ser solidaria. El préstamo que solicita lo utilizará en la compra de arroz, azúcar al por mayor y lo que falta para su negocio.
texts.en: Meliza is a member of the Rikchari community bank.  She is 20 years old and has a grocery store in her home.  She is also studying to become a nurse.  Her parents went to live in Vilcas and so she had to take care of her two younger siblings and the store.  At her young age, she learned how to run a business.  She is educating her siblings.  Her parents only come to see them from time to time to check that everything is going well.  Meliza feels very happy to be a member of Finca Peru because of everything she has learned.  Her relationship with her siblings is now very good and she has learned to be supportive.
